Ane Ballat of y? Captane of the Castell. 1571. At Ã¾e castle of Edinburch, Vpoun Ã¾e bank baith greine & rouch, As myne alone I lay, With paper, pen, and inke in hand, Musing, as I could vnderst?d, Off Ã¾e suddan decay, That vnto Ã¾is puir natiune Apeirandly dois come, I fand o? Congregatione Was caus of all and some, Whois aucthoris, instructoris, Hes blindit Ã¾ame so long, That blameles & shameles Both riche & pour they wrong. These wicked vaine venerianis, Proud poysoned Pharisianes With thair blind guydis but grace, Hes caused Ã¾e puire cuntrie Assist vnto Ã¾air traitorie, Thair prince for to displace: For teine I can not testifie How wr?gouslie Ã¾ey wrocht, When Ã¾ai Ã¾air Prince so pitiouslie In prisone strong had brocht, Abused hir, accused hir With serpent wordis fell Of schavelis and rebellis, Like hiddeous hound? of hell. These despaired bird? of Beliall Tho? no? but to advance Ã¾am sell, Fra Ã¾ai had hir down throwin, With errore and hypocrisie, To c?mitt open traitorie, As cleirlie now is knowin: But Ã¾e grit God ?nipotent, That secreit thochtis dois serche, Releivit hes Ã¾at innocent Out of Ã¾air rage so fearce; Provydet and guyded Hir to ane vncouth land, Whair wander & scl?der With enemeis none sho fand. Sen tyme of which ejectione, This cuntrie is c?e in subjectione And daylie seruitud, With men of weir in garisone, To the co?ones oppressione, By slicht & suddrone bloud; Whose craft, ingyne, & polycie, Full reddy bent is euer, Be treasone vnder amitie, Our nobles to disseaver: Some rubbing, some budding, Thair studie Ã¾ai employ, That slichtlie, vnrichtlie, They may Ã¾is realme ?joy. This guyding gart grit greif aryse In me, wha nawayis culd devyis To mend Ã¾is grit misch?ce; And, als I argoued all Ã¾e cais, I hard ane say w?in Ã¾is place: âWith help of God & Fr?ce I sall, within ane litill space, Thy dolouris all to drese; With help of Christ Ã¾ow sall, or Pasche, Thy kyndlie Prince posses: Detrusaris, refuisaris Off hir authoritie, None cairand or spairand, Shall outher die or flie. âThought God, of his just jugm?t, Thole Ã¾aim to be ane punishment To hir, Ã¾air supreme heid, ?it, sen Ã¾ey war particip?t With hir, & sho now penit?t, Richt suirly Ã¾ey may dreid: As wicked scourges hes bene seine Get for Ã¾e scourgene hyre, When synneris repentis from Ã¾e splene, The scourge cast in Ã¾e fyre; Swa Mortone, be fortone, May get Ã¾is same reward: His boasting, nor posting, I doe it not reguard. âBaith him & all Ã¾air c?pany, Thocht England wald Ã¾aim fortifie, I cair thaim nocht a leike: ffor all Ã¾air grit munitione, I am in suire tuitione: This hauld it sall me keip. My realme & Princes libertie Thairin I sall defend, When traitouris salbe hangit hie, Or make some sch?full end. Assuire Ã¾ame, I cuire Ã¾ame Evin as Ã¾ei do deserve; Thair tressone, Ã¾is cessone, It sall not make me suerve: âffor I haue men & meit aneugh, They know I am ane tuil?eour teoch, And wilbe rycht sone greved: When Ã¾ei haue tint als mony teith, As Ã¾ei did at Ã¾e seige of Leith, They wilbe faine to leive it. Then quha, I pray ?ou, salbe boun Thair tinsall to advance? Or gif sic compositione As Ã¾ei got Ã¾en of France? This sylit, begylit, They will bot get Ã¾e glaik?; Cum Ã¾ai heir, Ã¾ir tuo yeir, They sall not misse Ã¾air paik?. âAs for my ny?bo??? Edinburch toun, What salbe thair pairt, vp or downe, I can not ?it declair; Bot one thing I make manifest, Gif Ã¾ei me ony thing molest, Ãair buithis salbe maid bair. Gif fyre may Ã¾air buildings sacke, Or bullat beat Ã¾aim downe, They sall nocht faill Ã¾at end to mak The staires made in Ã¾is toun. Swa vse Ã¾aim, and chuse Ã¾aim, What pairt Ã¾ei will ensew; Forsake me, or take me, They sall drink as Ã¾ei brew.â He bade me rise & muse na mair, Bot pray to God, both lait & aire, To saue Ã¾is noble ludge, Which is, in all prosperitie, And lykwayis in aduersitie, Our Princes plane refuge. Thairfoir all trew men I exhort, That ?e with me accord, That we all, baith in ernest & sport, Aske at Ã¾e leving Lord, That hanged, or manged, Mot ilk m? mak his end, Wha dewlie & trewlie Wald nocht Ã¾is house defend. Finis.
